blocks.label: Info Text
blocks.value: Choose a monster at Engaged range and roll your Weapon Dice. Any dice that are a Hit trigger a combo, and you roll another attack die. You continue to combo until you no longer roll a Hit. Add up the number of Hits, with each Hit dealing your Damage.

blocks.label: Info Text
blocks.value:
You may change your fighting stance. Any effects from your stance will remain until you use another quick action to change your stance.
- Flow: After you attack a monster, you may take a free Move action.
- Parry: Monsters need a 5+ to Hit you instead of 4+.
- Slay: +1 damage per Hit, but take +1 damage from enemy Hits.

blocks.label: Info Text
blocks.value:
At the start of combat place 6d6 in front of you, representing the bullets in your gun. When you Spray Lead, choose a Near or Far monster and pick up as many bullets as you would like to fire, up to your Trigger Limit.
You may use bullets from any chamber that you have loaded. Each bullet that Hits deals your Damage. Bullets that have been rolled are spent, and are not available until you reload.

blocks.label: Info Text
blocks.value: You may reload up to two bullets into any empty chambers.

blocks.label: Info Text
blocks.value: Choose a Known Spell and roll 1d6 to cast it. On a Hit, resolve the spell’s effect. On a Miss, the spell fails. In either case, mark 1 point of corruption after resolving the roll. You can boost the spell, adding d6 to the roll, but also increasing the corruption by 1. After resolving a spell, compare the highest rolled die to your current corruption. If you have more corruption, roll on the Bane table and reset your corruption. Corruption is always reset at the end of combat.

blocks.label: Info Text
blocks.value: Roll 1d8. On a Hit, remove 1 corruption, on a Miss remove none.

blocks.label: Info Text
blocks.value:
1 : -1 for next Skill roll
2 : Next spell is with Disadvantage
3 : Can’t use Move action next turn
4 : Can’t use Quick action next turn
5 : Only 1 action next turn
6 : Take damage equal to corruption

blocks.label: Info Text
blocks.value: Before the turn order is determined, roll a number of d6 equal to your Tactics skill die size. These form your Strategy Pool. During combat, you can replace a die rolled by either an ally or an enemy with any of your Strategy Pool dice. Once that die has been used, it is discarded for the remainder of combat. This does not count as an action and is done during other combatant's turns.

blocks.label: Info Text
blocks.value: Before the turn order is determined, roll a number of d6 equal to your Tactics skill die size. These form your Strategy Pool. During combat, you can replace a die rolled by either an ally or an enemy with any of your Strategy Pool dice. Once that die has been used, it is discarded for the remainder of combat. This does not count as an action and is done during other combatant's turns.

blocks.label: Info Text
blocks.value: Choose another Slayer within Near. That Slayer may immediately make a Move or Quick action for free.

blocks.label: Info Text
blocks.value: You have a Plague Pool equal to your Mend skill die score. At the start of combat, after determining your Speed, you may place one Plague die/token from the pool on each character after you in the order. During combat, anyone with a Plague die is Infected, and will be affected by the current  Symptoms. If a character dies with a Plague die, it is removed from play.

blocks.label: Info Text
blocks.value:
Choose the effect of those infected with a Plague die.
- Hemophilia: Lose 1 HP at the start of your turn per Plague die.
- Clot: Heal 1 HP at the start of your turn per Plague die.
- Nausea: Actions are taken with Disadvantage.
- Pep: Actions are taken with Advantage.

blocks.label: Info Text
blocks.value:
Target a character at Engaged ranged and roll 1d8. If it is an enemy, deal 1 damage per Hit. If it is an ally, heal them by 1 HP per Hit. In either case, you may either place a plague die on them if they don’t have one, or remove
one, adding it to your pool.
